skill.name: contracts
skill.description: Contract lifecycle management - creation, consumption, modification, and resolution.
skill.summary: Contract lifecycle management - creation, consumption, modification, and resolution.
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill (SKILL.md) describing contract lifecycle management for multi-agent workflows. No executable code, no network calls, no file writes, no command execution. Pure protocol specification.

content.value_statement: Multi-agent workflows need clear interfaces between parallel tasks. This skill provides a complete lifecycle system for creating, tracking, and resolving contracts between agent tasks.
actual_capabilities: Define explicit interfaces for cross-task dependencies
Track contract versions and maintain change history
Identify breaking changes before they cause failures
Resolve contract conflicts between provider and consumer tasks
limitations: Does not generate implementation code automatically
Requires manual integration with existing workflows

use_cases.title: Define system interfaces
use_cases.description: Create contracts that define how microservices or modules interact with each other

use_cases.title: Coordinate parallel tasks
use_cases.description: Manage dependencies between concurrent deployment or build tasks

use_cases.title: Manage multi-agent communication
use_cases.description: Define how multiple AI agents share data and call each other's functions

prompt_templates.title: Create simple contract
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a contract for a user repository with methods to get user by ID and save user data

prompt_templates.title: Check breaking changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if adding a required field to this contract would be a breaking change for consumers

prompt_templates.title: Resolve blocked task
prompt_templates.prompt: A task is blocked because the contract is insufficient. Assess the impact and suggest whether to modify or extend the contract

prompt_templates.title: Design API contract
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a complete API contract including request format, response format, and error codes

output_examples.input: Create a contract for a payment service with charge and refund methods

best_practices: Define contracts before spawning parallel implementer tasks
Version every contract change and never edit history
List all consumers explicitly and track who uses each contract
anti_patterns: Modifying contracts without incrementing version numbers
Creating contracts with multiple providers for the same interface
Implementing against contracts without reading them first

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code all support this skill through Read, Write, and Glob tools

faq.question: How many contracts can I create?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. Each contract becomes a JSON file in the memory/contracts directory

faq.question: Can I use this with existing code?
faq.answer: Yes. Define contracts separately from implementation. Existing code can implement contract interfaces

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only manages contract metadata in the memory/contracts directory. No external data access

faq.question: What if contracts conflict?
faq.answer: The Contract-Resolver agent assesses impact and decides between modify, extend, or reject options

faq.question: How is this different from API specifications?
faq.answer: Contracts focus on agent task boundaries and dependencies, not just data formats
